main event: On February 24, 1954, three 13-year-old boys observed a red light in the sky near Long Beach, California, which appeared to stand still for 34 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as a round red light with a white light shining from one side., The object was estimated to be the size of a basketball., The boys were counting stars when they noticed the object., The object was stationary for 34 seconds before it started moving to the north., The reporting officer speculated that the boys might have mistaken an aircraft for the stationary light.
sighted object: round red light in the sky
